content.description: Ascend the chimney on the right side of the building, and finish on the first roof.
content.location: It is on Olin Hall's front side.

content.description: This has easy climbing, bring a backpack for the pumpkin. You can bail over the other side of the first ledge.
content.location: Begin on the loading dock of Dewick Dining Hall, and follow the obvious features to the highest roof.

content.description: Climb the obvious features on the side of the building. Everyone wants to send it.
content.location: It is on the side of Hodgdon Hall facing Packard Ave.

content.description: Ahh, the elusive jumbo statue...to grab an ear, heel hook the mouth, top the trunk, and try the tail? Legend has it that when you top this beast, you're part elephant forever.I cannot give away his secrets, as an elephant never forgets, but should you choose to tap tusks with old Jumby, know this: where you must place them I leave you that chore, but a double dyno -> toe hook -> undercling will even the score.Go bo's!
content.protection: Soft mulch at the base, though a good spot and a pad or two may be in order - a tumble would tickle!
content.location: At the entrance to Barnum Hall..., it is eleven feet tall and 18 feet long. 5,000 pounds of bronze...you can't miss it!

content.description: Start on the crimps right beside the water heaters, and go straight up until you hit two slopey sidepulls that point inwards. Throw to the windowsill from here, and power up to the roof. Heel hook the gutter then mantle the roof, and jump down from the entrance to Hodg Hall. This route got its name during the (potential?) first ascent, when I broke a foothold reaching for the windowsill from the sidepulls and missed the water heater with my ankle by inches! Luckily, there was an identical (and slightly stronger?) foothold just below it!
content.location: It is on Hodg Hall's right side, about 7 feet left of Nudes.

content.description: This area has some buildering problems. Check on local regulations before climbing.
